intro: Stillingia sylvatica var. genuina, commonly known as the American stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is adapted to moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded, well-drained soils.
